leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 科研知识图谱-实体规范化与证据链生态
leaf_cluster.task_chain: 抽取→对齐→融合→推理→版本→评测

queries: [WEB] open source graph database for knowledge graphs github

tools.name: GraphRAG Agent
tools.one_line_profile: Integrated agent for knowledge graph construction and RAG reasoning using Neo4j and LLMs
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) agent that integrates GraphRAG, LightRAG, and Neo4j-llm-graph-builder. It facilitates knowledge graph construction, search, and reasoning, incorporating DeepSearch technology for private domain RAG inference and providing an evaluation framework.

tools.name: Knowledge Extraction
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for extracting knowledge from natural language text into a graph database
tools.detailed_description: A Java-based tool designed to process natural language text and extract structured knowledge to populate a graph database. It serves as a bridge between unstructured text data and structured graph storage.

tools.name: LSQ
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for RDFizing and benchmarking Linked SPARQL Queries logs
tools.detailed_description: Linked SPARQL Queries (LSQ) is a framework designed to RDFize triple store logs and perform extraction, analysis, and benchmarking of SPARQL queries. It aids in creating datasets of Linked SPARQL queries for research and optimization of graph stores.

tools.name: ABLkit
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for Abductive Learning integrating machine learning and logical reasoning
tools.detailed_description: An efficient Python toolkit for Abductive Learning (ABL), a neuro-symbolic paradigm that unifies machine learning with logical reasoning. It enables the development of systems that can learn from data while adhering to logical constraints, suitable for scientific reasoning tasks.

tools.name: AmpliGraph
tools.one_line_profile: Library for representation learning on knowledge graphs
tools.detailed_description: A Python library dedicated to representation learning on knowledge graphs. It provides implementations of various graph embedding models to predict links and discover new knowledge within graphs.

tools.name: Kelpie
tools.one_line_profile: XAI framework for interpreting link predictions on knowledge graphs
tools.detailed_description: An Explainable AI (XAI) framework designed to interpret and explain the results of link prediction models on knowledge graphs. It helps researchers understand the reasoning behind graph-based predictions.

tools.name: AtomGraph Core-PHP
tools.one_line_profile: Generic Jena-compatible PHP Linked Data management library
tools.detailed_description: A PHP library for managing Linked Data, compatible with Apache Jena. It provides functionality for handling RDF data and interacting with SPARQL endpoints within PHP applications.

tools.name: sparql-engine
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for building SPARQL query engines in Javascript/Typescript
tools.detailed_description: A modular framework designed to facilitate the construction of SPARQL query engines using Javascript or Typescript. It allows developers to implement custom query processing logic for RDF data.

tools.name: PA4RDF
tools.one_line_profile: Annotation-based mapping framework between RDF triples and Java POJOs
tools.detailed_description: PA4RDF provides functionality on top of an RDF store to map RDF triples to Plain Old Java Objects (POJOs) using annotations and dynamic proxies, simplifying the interaction between Java applications and graph storage.

tools.name: RezoJDM16K
tools.one_line_profile: French Knowledge Graph Dataset for semantic relation prediction
tools.detailed_description: A French Knowledge Graph Dataset (RezoJDM16K) containing 53 semantic relations derived from RezoJDM. It is designed for training and evaluating graph embedding models and semantic link prediction tasks.

tools.name: entity2rec
tools.one_line_profile: Item recommendation tool using property-specific knowledge graph embeddings
tools.detailed_description: A tool that generates item recommendations by leveraging property-specific knowledge graph embeddings. It applies graph representation learning techniques to improve recommendation systems.

tools.name: entity2vec
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for generating property-specific entity embeddings from knowledge graphs
tools.detailed_description: A library that generates property-specific entity embeddings from knowledge graphs using node2vec. It allows for capturing specific relational properties in the embedding space.

tools.name: Explorer
tools.one_line_profile: Exploratory search engine for Linked Data
tools.detailed_description: An exploratory search engine designed for Linked Data, enabling users to navigate and visualize connections within knowledge graphs. It has been used in projects like MeMAD, SILKNOW, and Odeuropa.

tools.name: scylla-rdf
tools.one_line_profile: RDF store implementation based on ScyllaDB and Eclipse RDF4J
tools.detailed_description: An RDF store backend that leverages ScyllaDB for high-performance storage and Eclipse RDF4J for the RDF handling interface. It provides a scalable solution for storing and querying graph data.

tools.name: ULTRA
tools.one_line_profile: Foundation model for knowledge graph reasoning
tools.detailed_description: A foundation model designed for reasoning on knowledge graphs. ULTRA aims to generalize across different graphs and tasks, providing a robust capability for inferring missing links and reasoning over structured data.

tools.name: SymbolicAI
tools.one_line_profile: Compositional neuro-symbolic framework for building logic-enhanced LLM applications
tools.detailed_description: A neuro-symbolic framework that treats Large Language Models (LLMs) as semantic parsers and reasoning engines, allowing users to build compositional neuro-symbolic solvers. It integrates logic programming concepts with probabilistic generative models to enable complex reasoning tasks.

tools.name: FalkorDB
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance low-latency Graph Database powered by GraphBLAS
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance graph database that utilizes sparse adjacency matrix graph representation via GraphBLAS. It is designed to support low-latency graph operations and serves as a backend for Knowledge Graphs, supporting applications like GraphRAG.

tools.name: Openllet
tools.one_line_profile: Open-source OWL 2 DL reasoner for Java
tools.detailed_description: An open-source OWL 2 DL reasoner for Java, built on top of the Pellet reasoner. It provides standard reasoning services for OWL ontologies, which are widely used in bioinformatics and scientific knowledge management.

tools.name: LinkedGeoData
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for converting OpenStreetMap data to RDF/Linked Data
tools.detailed_description: A project that uses the OpenStreetMap data and makes it available as an RDF knowledge base according to the Linked Data principles. It includes tools for data extraction and conversion, enabling geospatial semantic queries.

tools.name: GraphLite
tools.one_line_profile: Embeddable lightweight graph database with GQL support
tools.detailed_description: An embeddable graph database written in Rust that supports ISO Graph Query Language (GQL). It is designed for lightweight applications requiring graph storage and querying capabilities.

tools.name: KGEmb
tools.one_line_profile: Library for Hyperbolic Knowledge Graph Embeddings
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch library for learning hyperbolic embeddings of Knowledge Graphs. Hyperbolic geometry is particularly effective for representing hierarchical data structures often found in scientific taxonomies and biological ontologies.

tools.name: Expressive Reasoning Graph Store
tools.one_line_profile: OWL reasoner and RDF triple store on Property Graph
tools.detailed_description: A system that combines an OWL reasoner with an RDF triple store architecture, built on top of a Property Graph model. It enables expressive reasoning capabilities over graph data.

tools.name: Neuro-Symbolic AI Toolkit
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for developing Neuro-Symbolic AI applications
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive toolkit designed to facilitate the development of Neuro-Symbolic AI systems, which combine neural networks with symbolic reasoning. This approach is increasingly used in scientific discovery to integrate data-driven learning with domain knowledge.

tools.name: Otter-Knowledge
tools.one_line_profile: Knowledge-enhanced representation learning for drug discovery
tools.detailed_description: A tool that enriches protein sequence and SMILES drug databases with a large Knowledge Graph fused from different sources. It is specifically designed to improve drug target binding affinity prediction benchmarks.

tools.name: TorchLogic
tools.one_line_profile: PyTorch framework for Neuro-Symbolic AI and Neural Reasoning Networks
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch-based framework for developing Neuro-Symbolic AI systems. It implements Neural Reasoning Networks, allowing for the integration of logical reasoning constraints into deep learning models.

tools.name: Whelk
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance OWL EL reasoner in Scala
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of an OWL EL reasoner written in Scala. It is designed to classify ontologies in the OWL EL profile, which is common in large biomedical ontologies like SNOMED CT and GO.

tools.name: Whelk-rs
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance OWL EL reasoner in Rust
tools.detailed_description: A Rust port of the Whelk OWL EL reasoner. It provides efficient classification for OWL EL ontologies, leveraging Rust's performance and safety features.

tools.name: NormalHermiteSplines.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Multivariate Normal Hermite-Birkhoff Interpolating Splines
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library for computing multivariate Normal Hermite-Birkhoff interpolating splines. This is a mathematical tool used for data interpolation and approximation in scientific computing.

tools.name: Metatheory.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Symbolic computation and equational reasoning library for Julia
tools.detailed_description: A library for general-purpose metaprogramming, symbolic computation, and algebraic equational reasoning in Julia. It implements E-Graphs and equality saturation, which are powerful techniques for symbolic mathematics and optimization in scientific computing.

tools.name: DHGE
tools.one_line_profile: Dual-view Hyper-Relational Knowledge Graph Embedding model for link prediction
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of the DHGE model which utilizes dual-view hyper-relational embeddings to improve link prediction and entity typing tasks within knowledge graphs.

tools.name: ViziQuer
tools.one_line_profile: Visual query tool for searching structured semantic data
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to facilitate the creation of SPARQL queries through a visual interface, enabling users to search and explore structured semantic data (RDF/Knowledge Graphs) without writing raw code.

tools.name: StarGraph
tools.one_line_profile: Graph database designed to query large Knowledge Graphs
tools.detailed_description: A graph database system optimized for querying large-scale knowledge graphs, supporting AI applications and data analysis over complex domains.

tools.name: TransE-Knowledge-Graph-Embedding
tools.one_line_profile: TensorFlow implementation of TransE and extended models for Knowledge Representation Learning
tools.detailed_description: A library implementing the TransE algorithm and its extensions for learning vector representations of entities and relations in knowledge graphs, facilitating link prediction and knowledge completion.

tools.name: RE-GCN
tools.one_line_profile: Temporal Knowledge Graph Reasoning based on Evolutional Representation Learning
tools.detailed_description: A model implementation for reasoning on temporal knowledge graphs, using recurrent graph convolutional networks to capture structural and temporal evolution for link prediction.

tools.name: GCN4KGC
tools.one_line_profile: Graph Convolutional Networks for Knowledge Graph Completion
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of Graph Convolutional Networks (GCN) specifically optimized for the task of Knowledge Graph Completion, addressing issues in standard GCN applications for KGs.

tools.name: KG-TACT
tools.one_line_profile: Topology-Aware Correlations for Inductive Link Prediction
tools.detailed_description: A model for inductive link prediction in knowledge graphs that leverages topology-aware correlations between relations, enabling reasoning on unseen entities.

tools.name: KGE-DURA
tools.one_line_profile: Duality-Induced Regularizer for Tensor Factorization Based KG Completion
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of the DURA regularizer for tensor factorization models, improving the performance and efficiency of knowledge graph completion tasks.

tools.name: KGE-HAKE
tools.one_line_profile: Hierarchy-Aware Knowledge Graph Embeddings
tools.detailed_description: A knowledge graph embedding model that explicitly models the semantic hierarchy of entities to improve link prediction accuracy.

tools.name: SALIENT
tools.one_line_profile: System for accelerating GNN training and inference
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance system designed to accelerate the training and inference of Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) using fast sampling and pipelining techniques.

tools.name: Clinical Knowledge Graph (CKG)
tools.one_line_profile: Platform for biomedical knowledge discovery and graph database integration
tools.detailed_description: An open-source platform that integrates experimental data with diverse biomedical databases into a graph database, automating knowledge discovery and analysis for clinical proteomics and related fields.

tools.name: go-light-rag
tools.one_line_profile: LightRAG implementation combining vector and graph databases
tools.detailed_description: A library implementing the LightRAG architecture, which integrates vector databases with graph database relationships to enhance knowledge retrieval and reasoning capabilities.

tools.name: SimplE
tools.one_line_profile: SimplE Embedding for Link Prediction in Knowledge Graphs
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of the SimplE model for knowledge graph embedding, providing a fully expressive yet simple method for link prediction tasks.

tools.name: hermiter
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient sequential estimation of PDF and CDF
tools.detailed_description: An R package for efficient sequential and batch estimation of univariate and bivariate probability density functions, cumulative distribution functions, and quantiles using Hermite series estimators.

tools.name: MillenniumDB
tools.one_line_profile: Property Graph and RDF engine
tools.detailed_description: A graph database engine that supports both Property Graph and RDF data models, designed for efficient storage and querying of graph data.

tools.name: Neo4j-KGBuilder
tools.one_line_profile: Knowledge Graph construction and visualization system based on Neo4j
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive system for building, managing, and visualizing knowledge graphs using Neo4j, Spring Boot, and Vue.js, facilitating the entire lifecycle of KG construction.

tools.name: Nucleoid
tools.one_line_profile: Neuro-Symbolic AI with Pythonic Logic Language
tools.detailed_description: A neuro-symbolic AI platform that enables reasoning and logic processing using a Pythonic syntax, integrating symbolic logic with neural capabilities.

tools.name: COSMO
tools.one_line_profile: Multimodal Knowledge Graph framework for camera trap species classification
tools.detailed_description: A framework that treats camera trap species classification as a link prediction problem on multimodal knowledge graphs, integrating contextual information for ecological monitoring.

tools.name: KG-R3
tools.one_line_profile: Retrieve-and-Read Framework for Knowledge Graph Link Prediction
tools.detailed_description: A framework for knowledge graph link prediction that utilizes a retrieve-and-read mechanism to enhance reasoning capabilities over incomplete graphs.

tools.name: CLEVR graph
tools.one_line_profile: Dataset for graph-based reasoning
tools.detailed_description: A dataset designed to benchmark and develop graph-based reasoning models, providing structured data for evaluating logical inference capabilities.

tools.name: OpenBG-IMG
tools.one_line_profile: Baselines for Multimodal Product Knowledge Graph Link Prediction
tools.detailed_description: A collection of baseline models and tools for the task of link prediction on multimodal product knowledge graphs, developed for the CCKS 2022 challenge.

tools.name: TopoNet
tools.one_line_profile: Graph-based Topology Reasoning for Driving Scenes
tools.detailed_description: A graph-based reasoning framework for inferring the topology of driving scenes, essential for autonomous driving perception and planning.

tools.name: KAG
tools.one_line_profile: Logical form-guided reasoning and retrieval framework
tools.detailed_description: A framework combining OpenSPG engine and LLMs for logical reasoning and factual Q&A on professional domain knowledge bases, enhancing RAG with logical forms.

tools.name: MoSE4MKGC
tools.one_line_profile: Modality Split and Ensemble for Multimodal Knowledge Graph Completion
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of the MoSE method for multimodal knowledge graph completion, which uses modality splitting and ensembling to improve prediction performance.

tools.name: ControlledVocabularyManager
tools.one_line_profile: Manager for RDF controlled vocabularies using Blazegraph
tools.detailed_description: A Rails-based application for managing and serving controlled vocabularies in RDF format, utilizing Blazegraph as the backend, facilitating data normalization and standardization.

tools.name: Graph-CoT
tools.one_line_profile: Graph Chain-of-Thought for augmenting LLMs with graph reasoning
tools.detailed_description: A framework that augments Large Language Models (LLMs) by enabling them to perform chain-of-thought reasoning over graphs, improving their ability to handle complex structural knowledge.

tools.name: Quetzal
tools.one_line_profile: SPARQL to SQL translation engine
tools.detailed_description: An engine that translates SPARQL queries into SQL, allowing the use of relational databases (like PostgreSQL, DB2) and Spark as backends for RDF graph querying.

tools.name: OWL-RL
tools.one_line_profile: OWL2 RL Profile implementation on RDFLib
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of the OWL 2 RL reasoning profile, capable of expanding an RDF graph with inferences defined by the OWL RL standard.

tools.name: NP-FKGC
tools.one_line_profile: Normalizing Flow-based Neural Process for Few-Shot KG Completion
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of a few-shot knowledge graph completion model utilizing normalizing flow-based neural processes to handle data scarcity.

tools.name: Graph-constrained Reasoning
tools.one_line_profile: LLM-based reasoning framework constrained by knowledge graphs
tools.detailed_description: Official implementation of the ICML 2025 paper 'Graph-constrained Reasoning'. It provides a framework for performing faithful reasoning on knowledge graphs using Large Language Models (LLMs) by constraining the generation process with graph structures.

tools.name: Reasoning on Graphs (RoG)
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for faithful and interpretable LLM reasoning on graphs
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of the ICLR 2024 paper 'Reasoning on Graphs'. It synergizes Large Language Models (LLMs) with Knowledge Graphs (KGs) to enable faithful and interpretable reasoning, generating reasoning paths grounded in the graph.

tools.name: PloverDB
tools.one_line_profile: In-memory database service for biomedical knowledge graphs
tools.detailed_description: An in-memory database service designed to host and serve biomedical knowledge graphs via TRAPI (Translator Reasoner API) compliant APIs, facilitating rapid querying and reasoning over biomedical data.

tools.name: SANSA-Stack
tools.one_line_profile: Big Data RDF processing and analytics stack
tools.detailed_description: A scalable big data processing stack for RDF data, built on top of Apache Spark and Apache Jena. It enables querying, inference, and analytics on large-scale semantic datasets.

tools.name: DeTrusty
tools.one_line_profile: Federated query engine over RDF sources
tools.detailed_description: A federated SPARQL query engine capable of executing queries over heterogeneous RDF sources, enabling data integration and retrieval across distributed scientific knowledge bases.

tools.name: Ontario
tools.one_line_profile: Federated SPARQL query processing engine for semantic data lakes
tools.detailed_description: A federated query processing engine designed for semantic data lakes, allowing efficient SPARQL query execution over diverse data sources.

tools.name: BioKEEN
tools.one_line_profile: Library for learning and evaluating biological knowledge graph embeddings
tools.detailed_description: A computational library specifically designed for learning and evaluating embeddings on biological knowledge graphs, facilitating bioinformatics research and link prediction.

tools.name: Kolibrie
tools.one_line_profile: SPARQL database and RDF stream processing engine
tools.detailed_description: A system combining a SPARQL database with an RDF Stream Processing (RSP) engine, enabling real-time querying and reasoning over streaming semantic data.

tools.name: pykg2vec
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for knowledge graph embedding and representation learning
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Python library for knowledge graph embedding (KGE) and representation learning, implementing various state-of-the-art algorithms for link prediction and triple classification.

tools.name: DacKGR
tools.one_line_profile: Dynamic anticipation and completion for multi-hop reasoning
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of a multi-hop reasoning model over sparse knowledge graphs that uses dynamic anticipation and completion mechanisms to improve reasoning performance.

tools.name: MetaKGR
tools.one_line_profile: Meta-learning framework for multi-hop reasoning on few-shot relations
tools.detailed_description: A meta-learning based framework for performing multi-hop reasoning over knowledge graphs, specifically targeting few-shot relations where data is scarce.

tools.name: PKGC
tools.one_line_profile: Evaluation framework for pre-trained models in knowledge graph completion
tools.detailed_description: A framework and evaluation study investigating the impact of pre-trained language models on knowledge graph completion tasks.

tools.name: Knowledge Engine SPARQL Endpoint
tools.one_line_profile: SPARQL endpoint for the TNO Knowledge Engine
tools.detailed_description: A component that provides a SPARQL endpoint interface for the TNO Knowledge Engine, allowing standard SPARQL queries to be executed against the knowledge base.

tools.name: KRACL
tools.one_line_profile: Contrastive learning with graph context modeling for sparse KG completion
tools.detailed_description: A model for sparse knowledge graph completion that utilizes contrastive learning and graph context modeling to improve performance on sparse data.

tools.name: AbutionGraph
tools.one_line_profile: Time-series knowledge graph database for real-time analysis
tools.detailed_description: A knowledge graph database optimized for time-series data, enabling real-time data analysis and management of temporal knowledge graphs.

tools.name: ConvE
tools.one_line_profile: Convolutional 2D knowledge graph embeddings model
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of ConvE, a link prediction model that uses 2D convolution over embeddings to capture interactions between entities and relations in knowledge graphs.

tools.name: TopQuadrant SHACL API
tools.one_line_profile: Java API for SHACL (Shapes Constraint Language)
tools.detailed_description: A Java API based on Apache Jena for SHACL, the W3C standard language for validating RDF graphs against a set of conditions (shapes).

tools.name: Awesome-Text2GQL
tools.one_line_profile: Fine-tuning dataset auto-generation for Graph Query Languages
tools.detailed_description: A toolset for automatically generating fine-tuning datasets to train models for Text-to-GQL (Graph Query Language) tasks, facilitating natural language interfaces for graph databases.

tools.name: MedReason
tools.one_line_profile: Eliciting medical reasoning steps in LLMs via knowledge graphs
tools.detailed_description: A framework for improving medical reasoning in Large Language Models by using Knowledge Graphs to elicit and guide factual reasoning steps.

tools.name: KICGPT
tools.one_line_profile: LLM with knowledge in context for KG completion
tools.detailed_description: A framework that enhances Large Language Models with knowledge context to perform knowledge graph completion tasks effectively.

tools.name: Cyber Doctor (Cyber Huatuo)
tools.one_line_profile: Medical agent based on multimodal LLM and knowledge graph
tools.detailed_description: An intelligent medical agent system that integrates multimodal Large Language Models with medical knowledge graphs and databases to provide disease diagnosis, analysis, and Q&A capabilities.

tools.name: ALANS
tools.one_line_profile: Algebraic representation learning for abstract reasoning
tools.detailed_description: A model for learning algebraic representations to enable systematic generalization in abstract reasoning tasks, contributing to neuro-symbolic AI research.

tools.name: ReasonGraph
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization tool for reasoning paths
tools.detailed_description: A visualization tool designed to display and analyze reasoning paths, aiding in the interpretability of reasoning systems.

tools.name: INSTANS
tools.one_line_profile: Incremental engine for standing SPARQL queries
tools.detailed_description: An incremental engine designed for executing standing SPARQL queries, suitable for RDF stream processing and continuous query evaluation.

tools.name: SpectralEmbeddings
tools.one_line_profile: Node embeddings from KGs using GCN kernels
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for generating node embeddings from knowledge graphs using Graph Convolutional Network (GCN) kernels and Graph Autoencoders.

tools.name: Sparqloscope
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark for SPARQL engine performance evaluation
tools.detailed_description: A generic benchmark suite designed for the comprehensive and concise performance evaluation of SPARQL engines.

tools.name: RRAM_COMPILER
tools.one_line_profile: Compiler for Resistive Random Access Memory (RRAM) array configuration
tools.detailed_description: A specialized compiler designed for the research context of RRAM technology, facilitating the configuration and testing of resistive memory arrays.

tools.name: MORe
tools.one_line_profile: Modular OWL 2 reasoner for ontology classification
tools.detailed_description: A modular reasoner for OWL 2 ontologies that combines a fully-fledged reasoner with a profile-specific reasoner to optimize classification performance.

tools.name: ANAPSID
tools.one_line_profile: Adaptive query processing engine for SPARQL endpoints
tools.detailed_description: An adaptive query engine for SPARQL endpoints that adapts query execution schedules to data availability and runtime conditions of remote sources.

tools.name: Sequoia
tools.one_line_profile: Consequence-based OWL 2 DL Reasoner
tools.detailed_description: A consequence-based reasoner for the OWL 2 DL ontology language, supporting multithreaded reasoning for improved performance.

tools.name: OpenRDF Sesame
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for processing RDF data (Mirror)
tools.detailed_description: An open-source Java framework for storage, querying, and inference of RDF data, serving as the predecessor to Eclipse RDF4J.

tools.name: G6VP
tools.one_line_profile: Online visual analysis tool for graph data
tools.detailed_description: A visual analysis platform and low-code tool for building graph applications, enabling exploration and visualization of complex relational data.

tools.name: Apache Jena
tools.one_line_profile: Java framework for building Semantic Web and Linked Data applications
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive framework for building semantic web applications, providing RDF API, SPARQL query engine (ARQ), and inference subsystems.

tools.name: KGT5
tools.one_line_profile: Sequence-to-Sequence Knowledge Graph Completion and QA
tools.detailed_description: A model for knowledge graph completion and question answering that treats these tasks as sequence-to-sequence generation problems using a T5 architecture.

tools.name: ArangoDB
tools.one_line_profile: Native multi-model database for graphs, documents, and key-values
tools.detailed_description: A scalable, multi-model database system that supports graph, document, and key-value data models with a unified query language (AQL).

tools.name: GraphRAG-rs
tools.one_line_profile: Rust implementation of Graph-based Retrieval Augmented Generation
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance implementation of GraphRAG that constructs knowledge graphs from documents to enable natural language querying and local LLM integration.

tools.name: DGL-KE
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance library for learning knowledge graph embeddings
tools.detailed_description: A scalable and easy-to-use package for training knowledge graph embedding models on large-scale datasets, built on top of the Deep Graph Library (DGL).

tools.name: SimplE
tools.one_line_profile: Implementation of SimplE Embedding for Link Prediction
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch implementation of the SimplE model for learning embeddings and performing link prediction in knowledge graphs.

tools.name: BiVE
tools.one_line_profile: Bi-Level Knowledge Graph Embeddings for Reasoning
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of BiVE (Bi-Level Knowledge Graph Embeddings) for reasoning tasks beyond simple link prediction, as presented at AAAI 2023.

tools.name: InGram
tools.one_line_profile: Inductive Knowledge Graph Embedding via Relation Graphs
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of InGram, a method for inductive knowledge graph embedding that leverages relation graphs to handle unseen entities.

tools.name: blazegraph-python
tools.one_line_profile: Python client library for Blazegraph Database
tools.detailed_description: A Python client library designed to interact with the Blazegraph high-performance graph database, facilitating data manipulation and query execution.

tools.name: Blazegraph Database
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance graph database supporting RDF and Tinkerpop
tools.detailed_description: A scalable, high-performance graph database with support for Blueprints and RDF/SPARQL APIs, widely used for large-scale knowledge graphs.

tools.name: Blazegraph Tinkerpop3
tools.one_line_profile: TinkerPop 3 implementation for Blazegraph
tools.detailed_description: The implementation of the Apache TinkerPop 3 graph computing framework interfaces for the Blazegraph database.

tools.name: MTL-KGC
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-Task Learning for Knowledge Graph Completion
tools.detailed_description: Code for the COLING20 paper 'Multi-Task Learning for Knowledge Graph Completion with Pre-trained Language Models', integrating PLMs with KG tasks.

tools.name: TA_TransE
tools.one_line_profile: Temporal Knowledge Graph Completion using Sequence Encoders
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of temporal knowledge graph completion methods, specifically focusing on learning sequence encoders as described in Duran et al.

tools.name: ConMask
tools.one_line_profile: Open-world Knowledge Graph Completion model
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of the ConMask model for open-world knowledge graph completion, capable of handling unseen entities by leveraging text descriptions.

tools.name: ProjE
tools.one_line_profile: Embedding Projection for Knowledge Graph Completion
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of ProjE, a neural network model for knowledge graph completion that learns joint embeddings of entities and relations.

tools.name: KBGAN
tools.one_line_profile: Adversarial Learning for Knowledge Graph Embeddings
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of KBGAN, an adversarial learning framework for improving knowledge graph embeddings by generating high-quality negative samples.

tools.name: Knowledge Graph Language
tools.one_line_profile: Query language for exploring knowledge graphs
tools.detailed_description: A domain-specific query language designed to facilitate the exploration and querying of knowledge graphs in a more intuitive manner.

tools.name: Virtue
tools.one_line_profile: Python and SKILL Framework for Cadence Virtuoso
tools.detailed_description: A framework to automate and interact with Cadence Virtuoso (EDA tool) using Python and SKILL, facilitating circuit design and simulation workflows.

tools.name: causalgraph
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for modeling and visualizing causal graphs in knowledge graphs
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed for modeling, persisting, and visualizing causal graphs that are embedded within knowledge graphs, facilitating causal inference and analysis in complex data structures.

tools.name: go-graphkb
tools.one_line_profile: Graph-oriented Knowledge Base engine written in Go
tools.detailed_description: A standalone graph database engine and knowledge base implementation written in Go, designed for storing and querying graph-structured data.

tools.name: CogniPy
tools.one_line_profile: In-memory Graph Database with Natural Language Interface and Pandas integration
tools.detailed_description: An in-memory graph database and knowledge graph tool that features a natural language interface and seamless compatibility with Pandas DataFrames, enabling data scientists to manipulate graph data using familiar Python tools.

tools.name: VirtuosoToolboxMatlab
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB toolbox for interfacing with Cadence Virtuoso IC Design System
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox that provides an interface to the Cadence Virtuoso IC Design System, allowing engineers to control design parameters and process simulation data within the MATLAB scientific computing environment.

tools.name: D2RQ
tools.one_line_profile: Platform for treating non-RDF relational databases as virtual RDF graphs
tools.detailed_description: A database-to-RDF mapping engine that allows accessing relational databases as virtual, read-only RDF graphs. It offers SPARQL access and RDF dumps without replicating the database into an RDF store.

tools.name: IGUANA
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark execution framework for RDF triple stores
tools.detailed_description: A generic benchmark execution framework designed for RDF triple stores and quad stores, allowing researchers to evaluate and compare the performance of different graph database systems.

tools.name: ActiveLink
tools.one_line_profile: Deep active learning framework for link prediction in knowledge graphs
tools.detailed_description: A framework utilizing deep active learning strategies to enhance link prediction tasks within knowledge graphs, aiming to reduce labeling costs while maintaining performance.

tools.name: Eclipse RDF4J
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable RDF framework for Java
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive framework for processing and handling RDF data in Java, providing functionality for parsing, storing, inferencing, and querying semantic data.

tools.name: neo4jd3
tools.one_line_profile: Neo4j graph visualization using D3.js
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library for visualizing graph data stored in Neo4j databases using the D3.js library, enabling interactive exploration of knowledge graph structures.

tools.name: Bulbs
tools.one_line_profile: Python persistence framework for graph databases
tools.detailed_description: A Python object-graph mapper (OGM) and persistence framework that supports multiple graph databases including Neo4j, OrientDB, and Titan, facilitating graph data management.

tools.name: libfactplusplus
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient Description Logic reasoner compatible with OWL DL
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library implementation of FaCT++, a highly optimized Description Logic reasoner supporting OWL DL and OWL 2 standards, used for ontology consistency checking and inference.

tools.name: embeddedCypher
tools.one_line_profile: Portable in-memory graph database implementing openCypher
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight, portable, in-memory graph database management system written in C++ that implements the openCypher query language, suitable for embedded graph processing.

tools.name: eye-js
tools.one_line_profile: WebAssembly distribution of the EYE reasoner
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript/WebAssembly distribution of the EYE (Euler Yet another proof Engine) semantic reasoner, enabling logic-based reasoning directly in web environments.

tools.name: SSL-Relation-Prediction
tools.one_line_profile: Self-supervised learning for Knowledge Graph Embeddings
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of simple yet state-of-the-art Knowledge Graph Embedding methods using self-supervised learning techniques for relation prediction tasks.

tools.name: SemTK
tools.one_line_profile: SPARQL query generation and data ingestion toolkit
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit designed to facilitate the generation of SPARQL queries and the ingestion of data into triple stores (like Virtuoso) via a drag-and-drop interface and API.

tools.name: Noctua Reasoner
tools.one_line_profile: Client-side reasoner for the Noctua curation platform
tools.detailed_description: A client-side reasoning engine developed for the Noctua platform by the Gene Ontology Consortium, enabling real-time consistency checking and inference for biological ontologies.

tools.name: InteractiveGraph
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based interactive graph visualization framework
tools.detailed_description: A framework for interactive visualization and analysis of large graph data, supporting data sources like GSON files and Neo4j, enabling visual exploration of complex networks.

tools.name: PyGraphistry
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated graph visualization and analysis library
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that interfaces with Graphistry's GPU-accelerated engine to load, shape, embed, and explore large-scale graphs for visual analysis.

tools.name: Reasonable
tools.one_line_profile: OWL 2 Reasoner built on DataFrog
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance OWL 2 RL reasoner implemented in Rust, utilizing the DataFrog Datalog engine for efficient semantic inference.

tools.name: INDRA
tools.one_line_profile: Automated model assembly system for causal graphs
tools.detailed_description: Integrated Network and Dynamical Reasoning Assembler (INDRA) is a system that extracts knowledge from literature and databases to assemble causal graphs and dynamical models for systems biology.

tools.name: BlazegraphBasedTPFServer
tools.one_line_profile: Triple Pattern Fragment server backend using Blazegraph
tools.detailed_description: A server implementation of the Triple Pattern Fragments (TPF) interface that uses the Blazegraph graph database as its backend, enabling low-cost querying of RDF datasets.

tools.name: Hash
tools.one_line_profile: Open-source, multi-tenant knowledge graph platform
tools.detailed_description: A self-building knowledge graph platform designed to be open-source and multi-tenant, providing infrastructure for structuring and querying connected data.

tools.name: RAGQnASystem
tools.one_line_profile: Medical QA system using Knowledge Graphs and RAG
tools.detailed_description: A medical question-answering system that integrates Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) with a Neo4j-based Knowledge Graph (DiseaseKG) and Large Language Models to provide accurate medical information.

tools.name: HyperGraphDB
tools.one_line_profile: General purpose distributed graph database
tools.detailed_description: An extensible, portable, distributed, and embeddable graph database designed specifically for artificial intelligence and semantic web projects, supporting generalized hypergraphs.

tools.name: pyKE
tools.one_line_profile: Library for Knowledge Graph Embedding models
tools.detailed_description: A collection of implementations of Knowledge Embedding Models (such as TransE, etc.), originally forked from OpenKE, providing a toolkit for training and evaluating embeddings.

tools.name: jena-jruby
tools.one_line_profile: JRuby wrapper for Apache Jena
tools.detailed_description: A wrapper library that provides access to the Apache Jena Semantic Web framework within JRuby programs, enabling RDF processing and reasoning.

tools.name: cl-grph
tools.one_line_profile: In-memory graph structure with Datalog query
tools.detailed_description: A Common Lisp library providing an in-memory immutable graph structure and a Datalog query language for graph traversal and reasoning.

tools.name: Visual-Knowledge-Graph-System
tools.one_line_profile: Visual knowledge graph system with Neo4j
tools.detailed_description: A system for visualizing knowledge graphs using G6 for the frontend and Neo4j as the database backend, facilitating exploration of graph data.

tools.name: CogKGE
tools.one_line_profile: Knowledge Graph Embedding Toolkit
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit and benchmark for Knowledge Graph Embedding (KGE) that supports representing multi-source and heterogeneous knowledge, designed for research and application development.

tools.name: data2neo
tools.one_line_profile: Relational data to Neo4j converter
tools.detailed_description: A library that simplifies the conversion of data from relational formats (SQL) to a graph knowledge database (Neo4j), facilitating KG construction.

tools.name: sesametools
tools.one_line_profile: Utilities for OpenRDF Sesame (RDF4J)
tools.detailed_description: A collection of utilities and tools for working with the OpenRDF Sesame framework (now Eclipse RDF4J), aiding in RDF data management and processing.

tools.name: python-virtuoso
tools.one_line_profile: Python wrapper for Virtuoso triplestore
tools.detailed_description: A Python wrapper for the Virtuoso triplestore, allowing users to interact with the database and execute SPARQL queries from Python applications.

tools.name: cl-jena
tools.one_line_profile: Common Lisp wrapper for Apache Jena
tools.detailed_description: A Common Lisp wrapper around functionality of the Apache Jena framework, enabling RDF graph manipulation and reasoning within Lisp environments.

tools.name: kineo
tools.one_line_profile: Persistent RDF quadstore and SPARQL engine
tools.detailed_description: A persistent RDF quadstore and SPARQL query engine implemented in Swift, designed for storing and querying semantic web data.

tools.name: Konclude
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance parallel reasoner for OWL 2 DL ontologies
tools.detailed_description: Konclude is a high-performance reasoner for the Description Logic SROIQV(D), which corresponds to OWL 2 DL. It employs a tableau-based algorithm and is designed for parallel processing to handle large and complex ontologies efficiently.

tools.name: Kùzu
tools.one_line_profile: Embedded property graph database management system
tools.detailed_description: Kùzu is an in-process property graph database management system (GDBMS) built for query speed and scalability. It implements the Cypher query language and is optimized for graph analytics and vector search.

tools.name: Pixy
tools.one_line_profile: Declarative graph query language on TinkerPop
tools.detailed_description: Pixy is a declarative, vendor-independent graph query language built on the TinkerPop software stack. It allows users to query graph databases using a logic-based syntax.

tools.name: LiteGraph
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight graph database with vector and relational support
tools.detailed_description: LiteGraph is a lightweight graph database designed for AI and knowledge persistence. It supports relational data, vector embeddings, and integrates with the Model Context Protocol (MCP).

tools.name: RAGAT
tools.one_line_profile: Relation Aware Graph Attention Network for KG Completion
tools.detailed_description: RAGAT is a graph neural network model for knowledge graph completion. It introduces a relation-aware graph attention mechanism to better capture the interactions between entities and relations.

tools.name: ELK Reasoner
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance reasoner for OWL 2 EL ontologies
tools.detailed_description: ELK is a reasoner for the OWL 2 EL profile, designed for high performance on large ontologies such as SNOMED CT. It supports classification and consistency checking.

tools.name: EmbedKGQA
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-hop Question Answering over Knowledge Graphs using Embeddings
tools.detailed_description: EmbedKGQA is a method for multi-hop question answering over knowledge graphs. It leverages knowledge base embeddings to handle data sparsity and improve reasoning capabilities.

tools.name: HyTE
tools.one_line_profile: Hyperplane-based Temporally aware Knowledge Graph Embedding
tools.detailed_description: HyTE is a knowledge graph embedding model that explicitly incorporates temporal information by projecting entities and relations onto temporal hyperplanes.

tools.name: InteractE
tools.one_line_profile: Convolution-based Knowledge Graph Embeddings with Feature Interactions
tools.detailed_description: InteractE is a knowledge graph embedding model that improves upon convolution-based methods by increasing feature interactions, enhancing performance on link prediction tasks.

tools.name: BERT-KG-Document-Classification
tools.one_line_profile: Document classification using BERT enriched with KG embeddings
tools.detailed_description: This tool implements a method to enrich BERT models with knowledge graph embeddings for improved document classification, integrating structured knowledge into text analysis.

tools.name: knowledge-graph-embeddings
tools.one_line_profile: Library of embedding-based methods for Knowledge Base Completion
tools.detailed_description: A Python library providing implementations of various embedding-based methods (such as TransE, TransH, etc.) for knowledge base completion and link prediction tasks.

tools.name: DRAGON
tools.one_line_profile: Deep Bidirectional Language-Knowledge Graph Pretraining
tools.detailed_description: DRAGON is a pre-trained model that jointly learns from text and knowledge graphs using a bidirectional approach. It is designed to improve performance on tasks requiring both language understanding and structured knowledge reasoning.

tools.name: HittER
tools.one_line_profile: Hierarchical Transformers for Knowledge Graph Embeddings
tools.detailed_description: HittER is a model for knowledge graph embeddings that uses hierarchical transformers to capture structural information and improve link prediction performance.

tools.name: openCypherTranspiler
tools.one_line_profile: Transpiler from openCypher to SQL
tools.detailed_description: This tool transpiles openCypher graph queries into SQL, allowing users to execute graph queries on relational database management systems (RDBMS) like SQL Server.

tools.name: cubic-hermite
tools.one_line_profile: Cubic Hermite spline interpolation library
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight JavaScript library for performing cubic Hermite spline interpolation, useful for scientific data visualization and numerical analysis.

tools.name: Graph-LLM
tools.one_line_profile: Boosting Graph Reasoning Ability of Large Language Models
tools.detailed_description: Graph-LLM is a framework designed to enhance the graph reasoning capabilities of Large Language Models (LLMs), enabling them to better process and reason over structured graph data.

tools.name: Holographic Embeddings (HolE)
tools.one_line_profile: Holographic Embeddings of Knowledge Graphs
tools.detailed_description: This repository contains the implementation of Holographic Embeddings (HolE), a method for learning compositional vector space representations of entire knowledge graphs, used for link prediction and other inference tasks.

tools.name: scikit-kge
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for computing knowledge graph embeddings with a scikit-learn compatible API
tools.detailed_description: A library to compute knowledge graph embeddings, providing a unified interface for various embedding models (Rescal, HolE, TransE, etc.) to support link prediction and entity classification in scientific knowledge graphs.

tools.name: Morph-KGC
tools.one_line_profile: Engine for constructing RDF knowledge graphs from heterogeneous data sources using RML
tools.detailed_description: A tool that generates RDF knowledge graphs from various data sources (relational databases, CSV, JSON, etc.) using RML (RDF Mapping Language) mappings, essential for integrating heterogeneous scientific data into a unified graph structure.

tools.name: Neo4j Graph Algorithms
tools.one_line_profile: Library of efficient graph algorithms for Neo4j
tools.detailed_description: A library providing parallel versions of common graph algorithms (Centrality, Community Detection, Path Finding, Similarity) for Neo4j, enabling network analysis on scientific data stored in graph databases.

tools.name: Neo4j Spatial
tools.one_line_profile: Spatial utilities and indexing for Neo4j
tools.detailed_description: A library enabling geospatial operations within Neo4j, allowing for the storage, indexing, and querying of spatial data, which is critical for geographic information systems (GIS) and spatial analysis in scientific research.

tools.name: LLM Graph Builder
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for constructing knowledge graphs from unstructured data using LLMs
tools.detailed_description: A workflow tool that leverages Large Language Models to extract entities and relationships from unstructured text (PDFs, docs, etc.) and construct a knowledge graph in Neo4j, automating the scientific knowledge extraction process.

tools.name: neosemantics
tools.one_line_profile: RDF and Linked Data import/export toolkit for Neo4j
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for Neo4j that enables the use of RDF and Linked Data, supporting ontology management, SHACL validation, and inference, which are essential for semantic interoperability in scientific knowledge graphs.

tools.name: Neo4j Graph Data Science
tools.one_line_profile: Enterprise-grade library for graph analytics and machine learning
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive library for running graph algorithms (community detection, centrality, embeddings) and machine learning pipelines directly within the Neo4j database, widely used for scientific network analysis and predictive modeling.

tools.name: Neo4j
tools.one_line_profile: Native graph database platform for connected data
tools.detailed_description: The core graph database platform that provides storage, query (Cypher), and reasoning capabilities for highly connected scientific data, serving as the foundational infrastructure for many scientific knowledge graphs.

tools.name: Neo4j GraphRAG Python
tools.one_line_profile: GraphRAG implementation for Python using Neo4j
tools.detailed_description: A library enabling Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) using knowledge graphs, allowing for more accurate and context-aware scientific question answering and reasoning by combining LLMs with structured graph data.

tools.name: OpenEA
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmarking framework for embedding-based entity alignment
tools.detailed_description: A software framework for benchmarking knowledge graph entity alignment algorithms. It integrates multiple datasets and baseline methods, providing a standardized environment for evaluating entity alignment techniques in scientific KG research.

tools.name: muKG
tools.one_line_profile: Library for multi-source knowledge graph embeddings
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed for multi-source knowledge graph embeddings, supporting tasks like entity alignment and multi-view learning, facilitating the integration and reasoning over distributed scientific knowledge bases.

tools.name: Helio
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for publishing heterogeneous data as RDF Linked Data services
tools.detailed_description: Helio is a framework that facilitates the publication of RDF data as a Linked Data service by translating data from heterogeneous sources. It supports automatic injection into triple stores, versioning, and SPARQL endpoint generation.

tools.name: Ontoweaver
tools.one_line_profile: Library for integrating tabular data into Semantic Knowledge Graphs
tools.detailed_description: Ontoweaver provides an easy way to integrate heterogeneous iterable data (like tables) into Semantic Knowledge Graph databases, specifically designed with oncology data in mind.

tools.name: Ontop
tools.one_line_profile: Virtual Knowledge Graph platform for querying relational databases as RDF
tools.detailed_description: Ontop is a platform that exposes relational databases as Virtual RDF Knowledge Graphs, allowing users to query them using SPARQL without materializing the data.

tools.name: Unified Rule Engine (URE)
tools.one_line_profile: Graph rewriting and reasoning engine for the OpenCog AtomSpace
tools.detailed_description: The Unified Rule Engine (URE) is a graph rewriting system used as the reasoning engine for OpenCog, operating on the AtomSpace hypergraph knowledge store.

tools.name: Morpheus
tools.one_line_profile: Cypher query language implementation on Apache Spark
tools.detailed_description: Morpheus (formerly Cypher for Apache Spark) brings the Cypher property graph query language to the distributed processing platform Apache Spark, enabling large-scale graph processing.

tools.name: Virtuoso RDFizer Mapper Scripts
tools.one_line_profile: Scripts for mapping non-RDF data sources to RDF
tools.detailed_description: A collection of XSLT stylesheets and scripts for mapping various non-RDF data sources to RDF, used in Virtuoso RDFizer Cartridges and GRDDL processors.

tools.name: Virtuoso OpenSource
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance Multi-Model RDBMS and RDF Triple Store
tools.detailed_description: Virtuoso is a scalable Multi-Model RDBMS, Data Integration Middleware, Linked Data Deployment, and HTTP Application Server Platform, widely used as an RDF Triple Store.

tools.name: OpenNARS
tools.one_line_profile: General-purpose reasoning system implementing Non-Axiomatic Logic
tools.detailed_description: OpenNARS is an open-source implementation of the NARS (Non-Axiomatic Reasoning System) theory, designed for general intelligence and reasoning under uncertainty.

tools.name: Open Semantic Entity Search API
tools.one_line_profile: API for named entity extraction and linking using knowledge graphs
tools.detailed_description: A REST API for named entity extraction, linking, disambiguation, and reconciliation against linked data knowledge graphs like SKOS thesauri or RDF ontologies.

tools.name: NornicDB
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance graph database for AI agents
tools.detailed_description: NornicDB is a graph database compatible with Neo4j's Bolt protocol and Cypher, featuring GPU-accelerated embedding search and intelligent features for AI agents.

tools.name: ONT-API
tools.one_line_profile: Unified API for OWL ontologies over Apache Jena
tools.detailed_description: ONT-API provides a comprehensive Java API for working with OWL ontologies, built on top of Apache Jena, facilitating ontology manipulation and reasoning integration.

tools.name: Owlery
tools.one_line_profile: REST web service wrapper for OWL reasoners
tools.detailed_description: Owlery provides a set of REST web services that allow querying of an OWL reasoner containing a configured set of ontologies, developed by the Phenoscape project.

tools.name: gStore
tools.one_line_profile: Graph-based RDF triple store
tools.detailed_description: gStore is a graph-based RDF triple store system that supports SPARQL queries and is designed for managing large-scale knowledge graphs.

tools.name: SPARQL-DL API
tools.one_line_profile: Query engine API for SPARQL-DL
tools.detailed_description: A query engine API for SPARQL-DL, enabling Description Logic queries over OWL ontologies, maintained by the Protégé project.

tools.name: SWRLAPI Drools Engine
tools.one_line_profile: Drools-based SWRL rule engine and OWL 2 RL reasoner
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of a SWRLAPI-based OWL 2 RL reasoner and SWRL rule engine using the Drools rule engine, maintained by the Protégé project.

tools.name: PyKEEN
tools.one_line_profile: Library for learning and evaluating knowledge graph embeddings
tools.detailed_description: PyKEEN (Python KnowlEdge EmbeddiNgs) is a Python library for training and evaluating knowledge graph embedding models, supporting a wide range of models and datasets.

tools.name: Parliament
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance triple store for RDF, OWL, and SPARQL
tools.detailed_description: Parliament is a high-performance, standards-compliant triple store for RDF, OWL, and SPARQL, developed by Raytheon BBN.

tools.name: Comunica Browser
tools.one_line_profile: Browser-compatible build of the Comunica SPARQL query engine
tools.detailed_description: Comunica Browser provides scripts and builds to run the Comunica query engine in web browsers, enabling client-side SPARQL querying of Linked Data.

tools.name: Ostrich
tools.one_line_profile: Versioned RDF triple store supporting changesets
tools.detailed_description: Ostrich is a versioned RDF triple store that supports offset-enabled queries for changesets, allowing for efficient management and querying of evolving knowledge graphs.

tools.name: virtuoso (R package)
tools.one_line_profile: R interface for interacting with Virtuoso Open Source graph databases
tools.detailed_description: A client library for the R programming language that enables scientists to query and manage data in Virtuoso graph databases, facilitating the integration of semantic web data into R-based scientific workflows.

tools.name: Sage
tools.one_line_profile: Preemptive SPARQL query engine for public Linked Data providers
tools.detailed_description: A SPARQL query engine designed to execute queries over public Linked Data interfaces with support for preemption, allowing for stable and responsive querying of distributed scientific knowledge graphs.

tools.name: ELepHant
tools.one_line_profile: A specialized reasoner for OWL 2 EL ontologies
tools.detailed_description: A reasoning engine specifically designed for the OWL 2 EL profile, enabling efficient inference and consistency checking for large-scale biomedical and scientific ontologies.

tools.name: unKR
tools.one_line_profile: Library for reasoning over uncertain knowledge graphs
tools.detailed_description: A Python library dedicated to representation learning and reasoning on uncertain knowledge graphs, supporting various models for handling probabilistic or confidence-weighted scientific data.

tools.name: SimPhoNy OSP
tools.one_line_profile: Ontology-based interoperability framework for scientific simulations
tools.detailed_description: A framework that uses knowledge graphs as a common language to achieve interoperability between simulation engines, databases, and data repositories, facilitating complex multi-physics scientific workflows.

tools.name: SociaLite
tools.one_line_profile: Query language and engine for large-scale graph analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Datalog-based query language and distributed execution engine designed for efficient analysis and data mining of large-scale graphs, applicable to scientific network analysis.

tools.name: SPARQL-Generate
tools.one_line_profile: Extension of SPARQL to generate RDF from non-RDF documents
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of the SPARQL-Generate query language that allows for the generation of RDF streams from various document formats (JSON, XML, CSV, etc.) and streams, facilitating data ingestion into scientific knowledge graphs.

tools.name: Pellet
tools.one_line_profile: Open source OWL 2 DL reasoner for Java
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive OWL 2 DL reasoner written in Java, widely used for consistency checking, classification, and query answering in scientific ontologies and knowledge graphs.

tools.name: Spfy
tools.one_line_profile: Integrated graph database for real-time prediction of E. coli phenotypes
tools.detailed_description: Spfy is an integrated graph database designed for the real-time prediction of Escherichia coli phenotypes and downstream comparative analyses. It leverages graph structures to store and query genomic data for biological research.

tools.name: RedisGraph
tools.one_line_profile: Graph database module for Redis using Cypher query language
tools.detailed_description: RedisGraph is a graph database module for Redis that implements the Cypher query language. It uses sparse adjacency matrices to represent graphs, enabling efficient storage and querying of connected data.

tools.name: qEndpoint
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable RDF triple store with full-text and GeoSPARQL support
tools.detailed_description: qEndpoint is a highly scalable RDF triple store designed to handle large knowledge graphs. It supports standard SPARQL queries along with full-text search and GeoSPARQL for spatial data.

tools.name: thi.ng/trio
tools.one_line_profile: Datatype agnostic triple store and query engine
tools.detailed_description: Trio is a datatype-agnostic triple store and query engine API. It provides a flexible way to store and query graph-structured data without being tied to specific RDF data types.

tools.name: KB2E
tools.one_line_profile: Library for Knowledge Graph Embeddings (TransE, TransH, TransR, PTransE)
tools.detailed_description: KB2E is a comprehensive library for Knowledge Graph Embeddings (KGE), providing implementations of foundational models such as TransE, TransH, TransR, and PTransE for representation learning on graphs.

tools.name: OpenKE
tools.one_line_profile: Open-source package for Knowledge Embedding
tools.detailed_description: OpenKE is an open-source framework for knowledge embedding, supporting various models for training and evaluating embeddings of knowledge graphs. It is widely used for link prediction and triple classification tasks.

tools.name: pyfactxx
tools.one_line_profile: Python bindings for FaCT++ description logic reasoner
tools.detailed_description: pyfactxx provides Python bindings for the FaCT++ description logic reasoner, enabling Python-based applications to perform logical reasoning and inference on ontologies.

tools.name: cognee
tools.one_line_profile: Graph-based memory and reasoning framework for AI agents
tools.detailed_description: Cognee is a framework that provides deterministic memory and reasoning capabilities for AI agents using graph structures. It enables the creation of knowledge graphs from data to support reliable retrieval and inference.

tools.name: TorchKGE
tools.one_line_profile: Knowledge Graph embedding library in Python and PyTorch
tools.detailed_description: TorchKGE is a Python library for knowledge graph embedding based on PyTorch. It provides efficient implementations of various KGE models and utilities for training and evaluation.

tools.name: TrustGraph
tools.one_line_profile: Graph-based tool to eliminate AI hallucinations via knowledge structures
tools.detailed_description: TrustGraph is a tool designed to construct and utilize knowledge graphs to ground AI agents, aiming to eliminate hallucinations by providing structured, verifiable evidence chains.

tools.name: LibKGE
tools.one_line_profile: Library for reproducible research in knowledge graph embeddings
tools.detailed_description: LibKGE is a PyTorch-based library for training, evaluating, and hyperparameter optimizing knowledge graph embeddings. It emphasizes reproducibility and provides a flexible configuration system.

tools.name: SkillBridge
tools.one_line_profile: Python to Cadence Virtuoso Skill interface for EDA automation
tools.detailed_description: SkillBridge provides a seamless interface between Python and the Cadence Virtuoso Skill language, enabling the automation of electronic design automation (EDA) tasks and scientific modeling in circuit design.

tools.name: CadenceSKILL-Python
tools.one_line_profile: IPC interface between Python and Cadence Virtuoso
tools.detailed_description: This tool facilitates Inter-Process Communication (IPC) between Python and Cadence Virtuoso, allowing researchers and engineers to control EDA workflows and simulations from Python.

tools.name: UStore
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-modal database with NetworkX and Pandas interfaces
tools.detailed_description: UStore is a high-performance multi-modal database that supports graph data structures. It provides interfaces for NetworkX and Pandas, making it suitable for scientific data analysis and graph processing.

tools.name: NebulaGraph
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed, scalable open-source graph database
tools.detailed_description: NebulaGraph is a distributed, scalable, and fast open-source graph database designed to handle super-large-scale graphs with billions of vertices and trillions of edges, suitable for scientific knowledge graph storage.

tools.name: Nebula Algorithm
tools.one_line_profile: Graph algorithms on NebulaGraph using Spark GraphX
tools.detailed_description: Nebula Algorithm is a Spark application based on GraphX that enables running state-of-the-art graph algorithms (e.g., PageRank, Louvain, Connected Components) on data stored in NebulaGraph.

tools.name: triplestore
tools.one_line_profile: RDF triple management and query library for Go
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight library to manage, query, and store RDF triples in Go, supporting the semantic web standard for knowledge graph data structures.

tools.name: NebulaGraph-NX
tools.one_line_profile: NetworkX API adapter for NebulaGraph database
tools.detailed_description: A library that allows users to manipulate and analyze graphs stored in NebulaGraph using the standard NetworkX API, facilitating scientific graph analysis.

tools.name: jupyter_nebulagraph
tools.one_line_profile: Jupyter notebook extension for NebulaGraph queries and visualization
tools.detailed_description: A tool enabling interactive execution of nGQL queries and graph visualization directly within Jupyter notebooks, supporting scientific data analysis workflows.

tools.name: nebula-dgl
tools.one_line_profile: Integration package for NebulaGraph and Deep Graph Library (DGL)
tools.detailed_description: A library facilitating the use of graph data stored in NebulaGraph for training Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) using DGL, bridging storage and scientific modeling.

tools.name: nebulagraph-ai
tools.one_line_profile: High-level API for graph algorithms and analytics on NebulaGraph
tools.detailed_description: A Python library providing a high-level interface to execute graph algorithms and analytics on NebulaGraph, simplifying scientific graph computations.

tools.name: Wikidata Query Blazegraph
tools.one_line_profile: Blazegraph-based RDF graph database service used by Wikidata
tools.detailed_description: The customized Blazegraph RDF database/triplestore used to power the Wikidata Query Service, enabling large-scale semantic knowledge graph querying.

tools.name: Yuxi-Know
tools.one_line_profile: Knowledge Graph Agent platform integrating LightRAG and Neo4j
tools.detailed_description: A platform for building intelligent agents using Knowledge Graphs and RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation), integrating tools like Neo4j and LangChain for knowledge management.

tools.name: NL2GQL
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for converting natural language to Graph Query Language (GQL)
tools.detailed_description: A utility leveraging LLMs to translate natural language questions into Graph Query Language (GQL) for NebulaGraph or Neo4j, facilitating knowledge graph querying.

tools.name: MKGL
tools.one_line_profile: Knowledge graph completion model based on a three-word language mastery approach
tools.detailed_description: A solver for knowledge graph completion that implements a 'Mastery of a Three-Word Language' framework. It focuses on learning representations for entities and relations to predict missing links in knowledge graphs.

tools.name: NATIVE
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-modal knowledge graph completion model for unconstrained environments
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of the NativE model for multi-modal knowledge graph completion (MKGC). It is designed to handle MKGC tasks 'in the wild', integrating visual and textual modalities to enhance link prediction accuracy.

tools.name: RMPI
tools.one_line_profile: Relational message passing solver for fully inductive knowledge graph completion
tools.detailed_description: A graph neural network-based tool implementing Relational Message Passing for Inductive (RMPI) knowledge graph completion. It is specifically designed to handle inductive settings where the model must generalize to unseen entities during inference.

tools.name: UniHR
tools.one_line_profile: Hierarchical representation learning framework for unified knowledge graph link prediction
tools.detailed_description: A solver implementing Hierarchical Representation Learning (UniHR) for knowledge graph link prediction. It aims to unify different aspects of KG representation to improve prediction performance.

tools.name: MKG_Analogy
tools.one_line_profile: Multimodal analogical reasoning framework over knowledge graphs
tools.detailed_description: A tool for performing analogical reasoning on multimodal knowledge graphs. It leverages multimodal data (images, text) associated with entities to solve analogy tasks within the graph structure.

tools.name: MKGformer
tools.one_line_profile: Hybrid Transformer model for multimodal knowledge graph completion
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning solver utilizing a hybrid Transformer architecture with multi-level fusion. It is designed for multimodal knowledge graph completion, effectively combining visual and textual information to predict missing relations.
